channel.title: [317]Server Offline?
channel.description:
I been making a rsps for 2 weeks now and i finally finished coding it. But i dont know how to make it download ready and runelocus says my server is offline... please help.
p.s if any one can help me with adding customsto my server cuz i always get nulls (i have files for a lot of customs).

item.description:
@teufel wrote:

kk ill try tht worked ty do i need to keep no-ip, cmb and utorrent open?

Read full topic

item.title: [317]Server Offline?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Do you use uTorrent? That might help.
Get uTorrent.
Close everything. (uTorrent, cmd, no-ip.)
Open no-ip. (don’t skip to it for no reason, CLOSE IT!)
Open uTorrent.
Close uTorrent.
Open CMD.
Open uTorrent.
Online!
Well, that’s what works for me.

Read full topic

item.title: [317]Server Offline?
item.dc:creator: @lil_wayne612 lil wayne612
item.description:
@lil_wayne612 wrote:

Okay, First go to no-ip.com and sign up there. Make a domain host and all that stuff, i recommend making it a no-ip one, not zapto or anything. Now you will want to go to start>run>cmd>enter>type in “ipconfig”, without the quotations, now get your default gateway copy it and paste it up into your search bar on the internet. then go to applications and gaming (depends on your router) and put in “RSPS” in the name the end port and start port is “43594” then make sure its enabled. and go back to your run>cmd>ipconfig> and find your ip adress in put your last three of your ip digit into that box, now you will want to add the exception to let your server threw, go to your control panel>security center>firewall>exceptions>then add put your server name in there and the port is “43594”

thats all thank me!

Read full topic
